She was brought up with middle class values, and when I ask her how she could live in such a manner, she told me she was sick and tired of working hard, and watching other people use the "system" (whatever that is,) and decided to join them. WHAT HAVE WE COME TO? I'M AFRAID TO ASK.

Topic.Title: Teapublican leader arrested

Message.Msg: The Afghan Quarterback The coach had put together the perfect team for the Chicago Bears. The only thing that was missing was a good quarterback. He had scouted all the colleges and even the Canadian and European Leagues, but he couldn't find a ringer who could ensure a Super Bowl win. Then one night while watching CNN he saw a war-zone scene in Afghanistan . In one corner of the background, he spotted a young Afghan Muslim soldier with a truly incredible arm. He threw a hand-grenade straight into a 15th story window 100 yards away. KABOOM! He threw another hand-grenade 75 yards away, right into a chimney. KA-BLOOEY! Then he threw another at a passing car going 90 mph. BULLS-EYE! "I've got to get this guy!" Coach said to himself. "He has the perfect arm!" So, he brings him to the States and teaches him the great game of football. And the Bears go on to win the Super Bowl. The young Afghan is hailed as the great hero of football, and when the coach asks him what he wants, all the young man wants is to call his mother. "Mom," he says into the phone, "I just won the Super Bowl!" "I don't want to talk to you, the old Muslim woman says."You are not my son!" "I don't think you understand, Mother," the young man pleads. "I've won the greatest sporting event in the world. I'm here among thousands of my adoring fans." "No! Let me tell you!" his mother retorts. "At this very moment, there are gunshots all around us. The neighborhood is a pile of rubble. Your two brothers were beaten within an inch of their lives last week, and I have to keep your sister in the house so she doesn't get raped!" The old lady pauses, and then tearfully says, "I will never forgive you for making us move to Chicago !!!!

Topic.Title: I HOPE REPUBLICAN CONTROLLED HOUSE PASSES THIS BILL - IF NOT WE ARE SCREWED

Message.Msg: the CBO has determined the following: The "fiscal cliff" deal that was designed to save money actually includes $330.3 billion in new spending over the next decade, according to the official estimate the Congressional Budget Office released Tuesday afternoon. CBO said the bill contains about $25.1 billion in new cuts, but those are swamped by the new spending on extended unemployment benefits for the long-term jobless and other new refundable tax credits that President Obama fought for. Of those cuts, only $2 billion are scheduled to take effect in 2013. And CBO also warned that some of the cuts Congress is counting are from programs on which CBO never expected the money to be spent anyway — such as cuts to the Consumer Operated and Oriented Plan, which was part of Mr. Obama's health care law.

Message.Title: Fiscal cliff
Message.Msg: House democrats led by Cantor oppose the agreement by the Senate on the fiscal cliff. These guys want total surrender to their view of what's good for the country. That only works in a totalitarian country..in democracy, policies are achieved by compromise. In a heavily divided nation only incremental compromise is possible and not grand bargains. In the Senate agreement each side got a little of what they wanted and for the good of the whole nation agreed on more limited fiscal package. The House must follow that example. I hope there are enough House Members with enough courage to stand up to the tea party faction to pass this legislation and not blow up the whole country because they are afraid. It's time the extremist on both sides are shown the door.

Topic.Title: Fiscal cliff

Message.Msg: The bill, I believe, is very favorable tax wise for those with high incomes. I like it. But, the House Congress reps should not expect at this time to also have spending cuts. The cuts will need to be addressed in the coming months while working with the president. And if there is no solution to cuts in coming months then it is Obama's economy and he has to live with it. But for now, if House does not pass it I would blame republicans for expecting too much. And we obviously go into a recession, very fast.

Message.Msg: This bill does not get into tax cuts, however, from a tax standpoint it is very favorable to high earners. I like it (and I am a very high earner). The cuts are a separate issue to be addressed over coming months. And if cuts are not addressed then this economy becomes Obama's and he lives with consequences. I recognize 51% voted for Obama and he should get 51% of his way. This bill is very favorable to rich. But again this current political system moves very slow and cuts will just have to wait until both sides come up with a plan over the coming months. For now, we have half of it done so let's get that part complete and start to work on cuts separately.

Topic.Title: Boehner's gittin' er done?

Message.Msg: Please try to read my posts more carefully or not at all. Of course everyone expect that the bill which passed Senate with huge majorities from both parties will be well supported by sensible people in both parties in the House IF it makes it to floor unamended for up/down vote. Question has always been whether there would be such a vote, whether the Speaker would allow a vote on a bill which the T-Reps in his party oppose but some Republicans and most Dems support. This could energize T-Rep opposition to his reelection as Speaker later this week when he normally won't expect any Dem support. It's well within the power of the leadership to dodge a straight up/down vote on the Senate bill and avoid that risk. It now appears that there will be a up/down vote on the Senate bill, raising the interesting question, "What deal, if any, has be made to assure the Speaker's reelection?"
